item.title: Network Debugging of Containerized Java Apps
item.description:
The other day, I had the need to look closer into the network communication of a (dockerized) JEE application. My usual tcpdump approach wasn’t applicable though because the traffic was TLS-encrypted.
Finally, I ended up with a setup where the app used a man-in-the-middle proxy for all its communication - that proxy transparently re-encrypted the traffic which gave me the chance to inspect every single message exchanged.
